Articles.Content: Next tile.

Ok, I'm doing a redo on my Command center, I may have hyper edited it on accident, I should have read more

Also zekes #Adriaticseverywhere

Hey Fleet Master, Make sure if you are going to do space missions to build a Mission Command and launch center. But you can still launch from KSC, just the mission is controlled from your base. Frankly I'm surprised that your letting spartwo get to duna first Zekes, that like your planet, with it being all red and all.

Try not to post black screencaps, i can only guess where your placing it, and if you can send coordinates from the map app.

addition

Wait I thought that we were delaying space missions for a while?

Yes that is what a port if for. Ships and all. But keep in mind that part count is still important.

Got it Spartwo ill update it when i get a few more in, but i marked it on my map.
Yep same one.

I stayed up 'til 4am yesterday trying to land a command centre, only to find out... I'm truly terrible at landing in a desired spot through atmosphere. Any tips?

Also the star on my flag is supposed to he tilted to point left, not up.

Edited November 13, 2013 by daemonCaptrix

Yes official ones and they never said they were doing it today. There will be a space race as a challenge for all players. But the second challenge for Kerbal Powers will be to design a Strike Jet, and a coastal missile boat and use both to hit a target as a test. Show Screen Shots of both launches and missile firing and missile strikes if you can manage it. I would recommend if you can show a video and that will cover everything but pics will be fine if you don't feel like it. Both craft should be of the light class.

Edited November 13, 2013 by camulus777
Additions.
I kinda like these Gantries but Part count, But my Obsession with the Titanic is kicking in O_O

I stayed up 'til 4am yesterday trying to land a command centre, only to find out... I'm truly terrible at landing in a desired spot through atmosphere. Any tips?

Also the star on my flag is supposed to he tilted to point left, not up.

Go into orbit and overshoot by quite a bit.Landing at KSC requires aiming as far east as the island runway from a 75km orbit.

Space Race you say?

Ill fix the flag. The image i was goin off of was tiny sry

If you overshoot but don't spend your all your fuel then slow down while you are dirctly over the area you are trying to hit you will hit your mark especially if you are slowed down enough and have your shoots out after your deceleration burn. If your still having trouble ill make a quick tutorial on landing on a select spot. But it also depends on the design of the craft. You have to also take into account that Kerbin is rotating and it will move quite a bit while you are in flight. Course corrections are a likelihood.

Edited November 13, 2013 by camulus777

Ill fix the flag. The image i was goin off of was tiny sry

If you overshoot but don't spend your all your fuel then slow down while you are dirctly over the area you are trying to hit you will hit your mark especially if you are slowed down enough and have your shoots out after your deceleration burn. If your still having trouble ill make a quick tutorial on landing on a select spot. But it also depends on the design of the craft. You have to also take into account that Kerbin is rotating and it will move quite a bit while you are in flight. Course corrections are a likelihood.

Forget that. I'll build a boat. xD

Whatever floats your boat... A plane would work too. with shoots. But if you build a boat you would be the first and i would love to see it

Edited November 13, 2013 by camulus777
Edit
Sarah I test was sucessful; tests prove the ship should have enough fuel for a Mun mission. Thursday's Mun Mission is go for launch.
I wana see your mission control
... let me get right on that...

I actually prefer boats because of range (With Hyper Edit) And it's alot easier to build a boat than a Jet that carries 4 fighters.

Also I'd like a launch date on Thursday for a Satellite launch.

Ok, Nebulous Base is going to be our mission control, with the PUMA as a mobile Satellite receiver... this will work

UPDATE!

T-Minus 10 hours to launch, and Sarah III has gone to Munar Orbit, and tests were conducted with the landing craft. It expended 20% of its fuel in a 400m/s burn, 30% in a 600m/s reverse burn, and 10% in a 300m/s rendezvous burn and successful docking, indicating it has plenty of fuel to land on the Mun and return to orbit.

Currently mission is go for normal schedule, all other Zokesian launches are on hold until Sarah III 'Hydro' gets off the pad on it's historical mission.

Edited November 14, 2013 by zekes
So the plan when I get home is to build a smallish boat as the command centre, then launch it to space, land in the ocean, then sail to my destination.
Rovers work as well. Ive done that on other planets before. I launched mobile base parts and landed within the area then drove the rest.
did everyone get the new challenge update?

yes i read the rules.

hey can you update my territory? It has 5 hexes now (see the little strip of land?)

Rovers work as well. Ive done that on other planets before. I launched mobile base parts and landed within the area then drove the rest.

But then it wouldn't be a boat.
